revised_title: The Influence of Robert Woodhouse on the Teaching of Calculus in Early 19th-century England
tldr: This article discusses the contributions of Robert Woodhouse to the improvement of calculus teaching in early 19th-century England. It highlights Woodhouse's advocacy for the Leibnizian notation and his influence on the Cambridge curriculum. The article also explores the challenges and reactions faced by Woodhouse during his time, as well as the impact of his work on the teaching of calculus.
